Classes in com.stickycoding.Rokon used by com.stickycoding.Rokon
AudioStream
          Handles a stream of sound, launched through RokonAudio.
Background
          This is a frame for backgrounds to be built from
DynamicObject
           
Emitter
          The emitter is the spawning point for particles, much work is still needed to be done here
Font
           
Hotspot
          Hotspot class is used as a way of simplying the detection of touches on the screen, and triggers onHotspotTouched
Layer
          A Layer contains your visible objects, Text, Sprites and Emitters.
Particle
          Represents a Particle inside an Emitter system
ParticleModifier
           
Polygon
           
RenderHook
          RenderHook's give you the ability to access, and modify OpenGL directly.
Rokon
           
RokonActivity
           
RokonAudio
          This is optimized for short sound files, which must be played quickly such as sound effects in games.
Shape
           
SoundFile
          SoundFile contains sounds which have been loaded into the RokonAudio class.
Sprite
          Sprite handles both visual and physical parts of in game objects.
SpriteModifier
          SpriteModifier allows repetive changes to the Sprite to be applied across many Sprites with minimal code.
Text
          Text is an object which can be added to Layer's that will draw text using TTF fonts loaded into the Font class.
Texture
          Representative of each image, can exist without being loaded onto the hardware
TextureAtlas
           
TextureBuffer
          A holder for the a Texture buffer, easier way of handling the ByteBuffer
TextureOptions
           
TextureType
           
Transition
          Transitions allow the appearance of basic changes between scenes.
Vertex
           
VertexBuffer
          An easier way of managing a ByteBuffer for vertices
